metadata.synopsis: Introduction to the last fight of the game against the Netherbrain. This dialog plays once the players enter the last combat arena, after the upper high hall escalade.Player climbs to the top of the Netherbrain. We see the Crown of Kharsus and realise that's where we need to cast the spell to dominate the brain. If the Emperor is against us, it appears, enthralled to the brain, and raises an army of daisies. If the Emperor is with us, the Netherbrain raises a bunch of super-thralls trained on our exact weaknesses.

27.speaker: Gale
27.text: Can't you feel it? We're almost there.

212.speaker: Gale
212.text: Once we ascend the Netherbrain's stem, we'll be in touching distance of the crown. Of reclaiming the powers of Karsus himself.

272.speaker: Player
272.text: I'm ready. Let's get you that crown.
272.context: NodeContext: Disappointed you've tried so hard to convince him

150.speaker: Player
150.text: Wait. We could end this now if you unleashed the orb.
150.context: NodeContext: Disappointed you've tried so hard to convince him

146.speaker: Gale
146.text: And I would die in the process, just to win the favour of a goddess who scarcely cares for me. We discussed this at length - I thought you and I were of a similar mind.
146.context: NodeContext: Disappointed you've tried so hard to convince him

112.speaker: Player
112.text: We did, but look at the devastation around us. You need to end this now.
112.context: NodeContext: Disappointed you've tried so hard to convince him

172.speaker: Gale
172.text: I could simply tell you what you want to hear, then ascend by myself and seize the Crown anyway, you know.
172.context: NodeContext: Disappointed you've tried so hard to convince him

86.speaker: Gale
86.text: I could simply tell you what you want to hear, then ascend by myself and seize the Crown anyway, you know.

243.speaker: Player
243.text: You could, but you won't. You know the stakes are too high to give in to your own ambitions.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: I know you won't. I trust you.

37.speaker: Gale
37.text: Sometimes I wish I were a more selfish man. Life would be so much easier. But alas...

256.speaker: Gale
256.text: You're right. The orb is the only way. All that's left for me to do is spirit you away to safety. Are you ready?

75.speaker: Player
75.text: No, I want to stay by your side.

21.speaker: Gale
21.text: Please... this will be so much easier knowing that my memory lives on with you.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I'm not going anywhere. We stay together, right to the end.

8.speaker: Gale
8.text: No. Let me do this on my terms. Besides - I need someone left to sing my praises, after I'm gone.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: You presume I wouldn't stand by your side, right to the end.

26.speaker: Gale
26.text: No... I would not presume that. I know quality when I see it.

195.speaker: Gale
195.text: But it won't come to that, for I have the means to spirit away those I care about to a safe remove, before the final curtain.

232.text: I thought I meant more to you than a sacrificial lamb. Clearly I was mistaken. I will not cast everything away, not when I know what's out there, almost within my grasp.
232.context: NodeContext: Disappointed you've tried so hard to convince him

229.speaker: Gale
229.text: I thought I meant more to you than a sacrificial lamb. Clearly I was mistaken. I will not cast everything away, not when I know what's out there, almost within my grasp.
229.context: NodeContext: Disappointed you've tried so hard to convince him

140.speaker: Gale
140.text: If the fight should turn against us, and we have no other option, then rest assured I shall unleash the orb. But I believe there is a much grander destiny in store for us.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Are you sure you want this crown? Look at the damage it's caused...

109.speaker: Gale
109.text: You urged me to this point, and now you falter? What would you have me do, sacrifice myself and hope that Mystra eulogises my ashes?

117.speaker: Player
117.text: No. But surely you see now how dangerous the crown is? We must make sure it's destroyed.

102.speaker: Gale
102.text: If you're wrong, we'll have squandered the chance for a better world. You understand that, don't you?

233.speaker: Gale
233.text: If you're wrong, we'll have squandered the chance for a better world. You understand that, don't you?

246.speaker: Gale
246.text: But... perhaps saving the day will suffice for now. A better world can always follow, so long as we survive.

32.text: Your fears are misplaced - the Crown will lead to a better world for all. I cannot ignore that.

16.speaker: Gale
16.text: Your fears are misplaced - the Crown will lead to a better world for all. I cannot ignore that.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: You're right. We're getting you that crown.

151.speaker: Gale
151.text: Then I think it's about time we ascended, don't you?

103.speaker: Player
103.text: So be it. But if the tide of battle turns against us, be ready to end this.

0.speaker: Gale
0.text: Should it come to that, I will not hesitate. But I think a different destiny awaits us.

259.speaker: Player
259.text: You must use the orb, Gale. Your sacrifice will save everything.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: You're distracted. Speak, or let your thoughts haunt you.
30.context: NodeContext: Gale looks somber and fatalistic

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.text: You're distracted. Speak, or let your thoughts haunt you.
49.context: NodeContext: Gale looks somber and fatalistic

171.speaker: Shadowheart
171.context: NodeContext: Gale looks somber and fatalistic

240.speaker: Astarion
240.text: Gale? You have a look. I'm not sure I care for it.
240.context: NodeContext: Gale looks somber and fatalistic

133.speaker: Wyll
133.context: NodeContext: Side-eyed concern - personal worry, but also pragmatism that this is the worst possible moment for Gale to fall ill. We are standing atop the Netherbrain, floating high above the city

35.speaker: Karlach
35.context: NodeContext: Side-eyed concern - personal worry, but also pragmatism that this is the worst possible moment for Gale to fall ill. We are standing atop the Netherbrain, floating high above the city

274.speaker: Halsin
274.text: Gale - what's troubling you? We're nearly at the end, I know it
274.context: NodeContext: Side-eyed concern - personal worry, but also pragmatism that this is the worst possible moment for Gale to fall ill. We are standing atop the Netherbrain, floating high above the city

4.speaker: Jaheira
4.text: Are you well, Gale? This would be a bad spot to fall into a faint.
4.context: NodeContext: Side-eyed concern - personal worry, but also pragmatism that this is the worst possible moment for Gale to fall ill. We are standing atop the Netherbrain, floating high above the city

147.speaker: Player
147.text: I can feel it - the thing in your chest - it's ready to blow, isn't it? It's certainly a possible way out...
147.context: NodeContext: Response to "If it seem like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me."

178.speaker: The Emperor
178.text: I can feel it - the thing in your chest - it's ready to blow, isn't it? It's certainly a possible way out...
178.context: NodeContext: Response to "If it seem like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me."

179.speaker: Orpheus
179.context: NodeContext: Response to "If it seem like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me."

261.speaker: Player
261.text: The orb stirs because it knows the Crown of Karsus is close. It waits for you to claim it. All you have to do is ascend.
261.context: NodeContext: Response to "If it seem like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me."

216.speaker: Player
216.text: If it seems like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me.
216.context: NodeContext: Response to "If it seem like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me."

166.speaker: Player
166.text: ...and the Grand Design will be stopped. An honourable contingency, Gale. And one I mean to avoid.
166.context: NodeContext: Response to "If it seem like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me."

137.speaker: Lae'zel
137.text: ...and the Grand Design will be stopped. An honourable contingency, Gale. And one I mean to avoid.
137.context: NodeContext: Response to "If it seem like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me."

180.speaker: Shadowheart
180.text: No harm in clinging to optimism a little longer. If events turn against us, at least we'll know you can act. The Absolute isn't winning, one way or another.
180.context: NodeContext: Response to "If it seem like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me."

228.speaker: Astarion
228.text: Well I care for that even less. Let's make sure we prevail, then.
228.context: NodeContext: Response to "If it seem like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me."

120.speaker: Wyll
120.text: Perish the thought. I have no intention of failing, and neither should you.
120.context: NodeContext: Having just been warned that Gale might need to self-destruct if we're losing the battle - which would kill us all

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: I'm on borrowed time anyway. But don't pull the pin until you have to, hey? We might still win the old fashioned way.
22.context: NodeContext: Having just been warned that Gale might need to self-destruct if we're losing the battle - which would kill us all

1.speaker: Halsin
1.text: That orb can deliver us victory - but a sort that we would not live to enjoy. Let us at least see how we fare, and if all else fails... the option remains.
1.context: NodeContext: Having just been warned that Gale might need to self-destruct if we're losing the battle - which would kill us all

24.speaker: Jaheira
24.text: Then we'd best win, wizard. If we cannot... well, this is quite the view.
24.context: NodeContext: Having just been warned that Gale might need to self-destruct if we're losing the battle - which would kill us all

20.speaker: Minsc
20.text: To die destroying a great and grotesque brain - I think this might well be my destiny.
20.context: NodeContext: Pure, breathless wonder - he's excited for the battle to come, and not at all put off by the prospect of certain death

17.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
17.text: The moment our victory is not assured, do not hesitate. Destroy the brain, whatever the cost - even if it is our lives.
17.context: NodeContext: determined, but with a heavy undertone of grief. She's ready to die if it's necessary, but she REALLY wants to live - and is thinking of her unborn child's life as well.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Move forward. Perhaps you will find a way to stop the brain, without resorting to the orb.
116.context: NodeContext: Interrupted when Gale casts a spell on Wyll.

15.speaker: Player
15.context: NodeContext: Interrupted when Gale casts a spell on Wyll.

265.speaker: Narrator
265.text: *Perhaps united, you can stop the brain without having to resort to the orb... but should you risk failure, the final, irreversible solution remains within your power.*

159.speaker: Player
159.text: This is where we part ways. I'm sending you someplace safe, then I'm going to put a stop to this - alone.
159.context: NodeContext: Interrupted when Gale casts a spell on Wyll.

173.speaker: Player
173.text: You were always a stubborn one, Gale. Well - if this is to be your end, then you have made the most of it.
173.context: NodeContext: Interrupted when Gale casts a spell on Wyll.

45.speaker: Lae'zel
45.text: You were always a stubborn one, Gale. Well - if this is to be your end, then you have made the most of it.
45.context: NodeContext: Interrupted when Gale casts a spell on Wyll.

196.speaker: Shadowheart
196.text: You'd do that? Sacrifice yourself for us...? If this is truly what you want, then thank you.
196.context: NodeContext: Interrupted when Gale casts a spell on Wyll.

231.speaker: Astarion
231.text: I... I don't know what to say. Thank you.
231.context: NodeContext: Interrupted when Gale casts a spell on Wyll.

12.speaker: Wyll
12.text: Damned stubborn fool. We can stop this thing. You don't have to -
12.context: NodeContext: Interrupted when Gale casts a spell on Wyll.

55.speaker: Player
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avatar Gale casts a teleportation spell on his companions. A spiral of blue magic rises from the ground, enveloping them It grows in intensity, into a vortex. When it fades, they are gone. Gale turns to ascend the stalk.

82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avatar Gale casts a teleportation spell on his companions. A spiral of blue magic rises from the ground, enveloping them It grows in intensity, into a vortex. When it fades, they are gone. Gale turns to ascend the stalk.

115.speaker: Karlach
115.text: See you on the other side, Gale. It's been an honour.
115.context: NodeContext: Looking at threat ahead, then back to Gale. He's making a heroic sacrifice - the 'Ah' is after a beat as she recognises what he's about to do  - cast a spell to send her away.

255.speaker: Halsin
255.text: You would step forth, alone, to save the world at the expense of your own life. There would be no greater sacrifice.
255.context: NodeContext: Looking at threat ahead, then back to Gale. He's making a heroic sacrifice - the 'Ah' is after a beat as she recognises what he's about to do  - cast a spell to send her away.

99.speaker: Jaheira
99.text: Too foolish for me to allow, pup. So why do I feel like you aren't asking? Ah.
99.context: NodeContext: Looking at threat ahead, then back to Gale. He's making a heroic sacrifice - the 'Ah' is after a beat as she recognises what he's about to do  - cast a spell to send her away.

144.speaker: Minsc
144.text: Alone, wizard? I thought you were of the clever kind. Boo and I are here, and here we -
144.context: NodeContext: Refusing to let Gale go on alone - is cut off mid-sentence as Gale teleports them away

36.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
36.text: And what if your nerve fails at the last, wizard? I would rather trust my courage than yours.
36.context: NodeContext: intense moment - the final battle is unfolding, and Gale just offered to sacrifice himself. Minthara is not convinced

141.speaker: Player
141.text: Step forward - alone. Once up there, you must unleash the orb without hesitation, or all is lost.
141.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avatar Gale steps towards the stalk, grimly determined expression

13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avatar Gale steps towards the stalk, grimly determined expression

254.speaker: Minsc
254.text: You do not look well, wizard. Beyond even your daily feebleness.
254.context: NodeContext: Brute concern, in his own way. Gale is looking up at the Netherbrain, his chest orb preparing to explode

23.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
23.text: Are you afraid, wizard? There is no shame in it when faced with madness such as this.
23.context: NodeContext: determined and reassuring - gentler than her usual self, as she encourages an ally to show courage right before the final battle with the netherbrain

204.speaker: Gale
204.text: I can end this now - stop the Absolute, and spare the city. The stage is set for my final act. Mystra's bidding. And the redemption that lies beyond.
204.context: NodeContext: readying himself for death, saying goodbye

186.speaker: Gale
186.text: You've brought me right where I need to be - I have no right to ask more of you. It's time I spirited you to safety, for this is a fate I must face alone.
186.context: NodeContext: readying himself for death, saying goodbye

191.speaker: Player
191.text: I don't want to leave you.
191.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Forget it, Gale. You don't have to do this.
41.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

131.speaker: Gale
131.text: What's the alternative? I allow the Absolute to have its way? Die in vain along with all its victims? Or flee, and live on in shame?

257.speaker: Gale
257.text: It's just a choice between two deaths. Quick and meaningful, or torturous and pointless.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: Are you sure about this? There must be another way - one that lets you live.
211.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

74.speaker: Gale
74.text: I'm sure such an outcome is possible, but why risk it? If we ascend there, and try to fight the good fight... well, there're no guarantees.
74.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

193.speaker: Gale
193.text: But this way, we'll know the matter is done, and we'll know exactly what it shall cost - me, and me alone.
193.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

249.speaker: Gale
249.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

7.speaker: Player
7.text: You know there's always another way.
7.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

57.speaker: Gale
57.text: Always another way, yes - but not necessarily a better way.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: What about all we shared together? Are you just going to give up?
90.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

52.speaker: Gale
52.text: This isn't giving up it's securing victory, at a price I am willing to pay. And everything we shared can live on - with you.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: No, we can ascend together and put an end to this. Should it look like we'll fail... that's your moment.
168.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

6.speaker: Gale
6.text: You'd be dying in vain. I don't need company to sacrifice myself.
6.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

260.speaker: Gale
260.text: Please. For too long I've lived in fear of taking a host of innocents with me when I expired. Now at least I can be assured my demise will be saving them instead.
260.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

98.speaker: Player
98.text: No, Gale. We're going to end this together - and live to tell the tale.
98.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

176.speaker: Gale
176.text: If you're mistaken, this could be the end of everything. We will be failing, right at the last hurdle.
176.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

218.speaker: Gale
218.text: But... I only made it this far thanks to you. Who am I to question such sterling guidance now?
218.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

227.speaker: Gale
227.text: Mystra won't be pleased... but perhaps trying to please the gods is a fool's errand.
227.context: NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

175.speaker: Gale
175.text: Lead on, then. I shall stay my hand as long as I can - but if the tide of battle turns against us, remember I have the means to bring a swift end to this.

234.speaker: Player
234.text: I won't stand in your way, then. Farewell, Gale.
234.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale begins to cast a teleportation spell.NodeContext: Latin: foo-GA-moos in-FER-nee blan-dee-MEN-ta

167.speaker: Gale
167.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale begins to cast a teleportation spell.NodeContext: Latin: foo-GA-moos in-FER-nee blan-dee-MEN-ta

61.speaker: Gale
61.text: There's endless wonder out there. Infinite possibilities. Perhaps fate will bring us back together, before the universe dims.
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale begins to cast a teleportation spell.NodeContext: Latin: foo-GA-moos in-FER-nee blan-dee-MEN-ta

190.speaker: Gale
190.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale begins to cast a teleportation spell.NodeContext: Latin: foo-GA-moos in-FER-nee blan-dee-MEN-ta

54.context: CinematicNodeContext: A spiral of blue magic rises from the ground, enveloping the player. It grows in intensity, into a vortex. Player's POV: one last glimpse of Gale smiling sadly, before the blue magic swallows his image...

31.speaker: Player
31.text: If this is truly what you want...

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: What I want is a life I could share with you, but alas... knowing you're still out there will suffice for now.

89.speaker: Gale
89.text: What I want? Perhaps not... But what I need? I believe so. But it may not be the last turn of the page, even if it seems so.

262.speaker: Player
262.text: You don't have to do this, Gale. We can bring the Crown to Mystra.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Gesture to the fact that you are now a mind flayer. Gale's self-sacrifice is not necessary.

33.speaker: Gale
33.text: Still, you will be taking unnecessary risks by proceeding. This could all be over in mere moments, if I ascend alone.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Orpheus has already transformed into a mind flayer.

200.speaker: Gale
200.text: True, but it's not too late to reconsider. This would all be over in mere moments, if I ascend alone.

241.speaker: Player
241.text: We have the Emperor's support - your sacrifice isn't necessary.

73.speaker: Gale
73.text: Are you quite sure you wish to place all your trust there? This would all be over in mere moments, if I ascend alone.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: You intend to go up there by yourself? To die alone?

139.speaker: Gale
139.text: As much as I enjoy your company, I'm not willing to kill you just to wring out a few last moments.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Don't be ridiculous, Gale. This isn't necessary.

132.speaker: Gale
132.text: I must disagree. It is necessary - and the right thing to do. Every moment I hesitate is costing lives.

51.speaker: Narrator
51.context: CinematicNodeContext:  |You grab onto the tentacle, pulses of mocking noise burst through your mind. You push through, take a firm grip and make your ascent.|

164.speaker: Narrator
164.text: *There it is - the Crown of Karsus, the site of power, the site of domination.*
164.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks up and sees the Crown of Kharsus.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: We need to use the Netherstones on the Crown. That is our fated path.
100.context: NodeContext: Looking up at the Crown of Karsus on top of the Netherbrain

127.speaker: Lae'zel
127.text: We need to use the Netherstones on the Crown. That is our fated path.
127.context: NodeContext: Looking up at the Crown of Karsus on top of the Netherbrain

205.speaker: Shadowheart
205.text: The Netherstones - perhaps if we use them here, they'll work this time.
205.context: NodeContext: Looking up at the Crown of Karsus on top of the Netherbrain

217.speaker: Astarion
217.text: That's it! We have to use the Netherstones on the Crown - it's the only hope we have.
217.context: NodeContext: Looking up at the Crown of Karsus on top of the Netherbrain

165.speaker: Wyll
165.text: There lies our answer. Use the Netherstones on the Crown, and we can bring an end to this.
165.context: NodeContext: Looking up at the Crown of Karsus on top of the Netherbrain

206.speaker: Gale
206.text: The Netherstones might prove more effective if we use them now.
206.context: NodeContext: Looking up at the Crown of Karsus on top of the Netherbrain

126.speaker: Karlach
126.text: Looks like that Crown could use some Netherstones. If these things were ever going to work, it's now.
126.context: NodeContext: Looking up at the Crown of Karsus on top of the Netherbrain

268.speaker: Halsin
268.text: The Netherstones may yet work - this time.
268.context: NodeContext: Looking up at the Crown of Karsus on top of the Netherbrain

25.speaker: Jaheira
25.text: If we are to try the stones once more - we ought to do it there.
25.context: NodeContext: Looking up at the Crown of Karsus on top of the Netherbrain

182.speaker: Player
182.text: That face... the one in my dreams...
182.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Emperor lands in battle on a dragon. 
Party reacts with horror. 
Emperor makes a gesture with his hand to summon the super-Daisies

125.text: That face... the one in my dreams...
125.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Emperor lands in battle on a dragon. 
Party reacts with horror. 
Emperor makes a gesture with his hand to summon the super-Daisies

253.text: That face... the one in my dreams...
253.context: CinematicNodeContext: Suddenly, a bunch of human-sized growth-pods emerge from the netherbrain's surface. They split apart and the Daisy forms of the present party members step out, ready for combat.

244.text: That face... the one in my dreams...
244.context: CinematicNodeContext: Suddenly, a bunch of human-sized growth-pods emerge from the netherbrain's surface. They split apart and the Daisy forms of the present party members step out, ready for combat.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: That face... the one in my dreams...
84.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed bravado - the Brain has just dramatically spawned identical copies of the player's dream figure that we must fight

197.speaker: Lae'zel
197.text: That face... the one in my dreams...
197.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed bravado - the Brain has just dramatically spawned identical copies of the player's dream figure that we must fight

153.speaker: Shadowheart
153.text: That's... that's the person from my dreams...
153.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed bravado - the Brain has just dramatically spawned identical copies of the player's dream figure that we must fight

215.speaker: Astarion
215.text: I know you - I saw you in my dreams.
215.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed bravado - the Brain has just dramatically spawned identical copies of the player's dream figure that we must fight

170.speaker: Wyll
170.text: That face. The one from my dreams...
170.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed bravado - the Brain has just dramatically spawned identical copies of the player's dream figure that we must fight

220.speaker: Gale
220.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed bravado - the Brain has just dramatically spawned identical copies of the player's dream figure that we must fight

114.speaker: Karlach
114.text: My gods! I didn't think they were real. Not really.
114.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed bravado - the Brain has just dramatically spawned identical copies of the player's dream figure that we must fight

161.speaker: Halsin
161.text: The infamous figure from your dreams, I take it.
161.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed bravado - the Brain has just dramatically spawned identical copies of the player's dream figure that we must fight

185.speaker: Jaheira
185.text: Your dream visitors, I take it? I thought they would be prettier.
185.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed bravado - the Brain has just dramatically spawned identical copies of the player's dream figure that we must fight

208.speaker: Minsc
208.text: The dream invaders - but these ones have real skulls for the splitting.
208.context: NodeContext: Violent relish -  the Brain has just spawned identical copies of the player's dream figure that we must figh

97.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
97.text: If we must butcher our dreams, so be it.
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor disembarks dragonNodeContext: Emperor is against the player now, and enthralled to the Netherbrain

207.speaker: Player
207.text: I know you. I know everything about you. Your thoughts, your feelings, your weaknesses.
207.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor disembarks dragonNodeContext: Emperor is against the player now, and enthralled to the Netherbrain

267.speaker: The Emperor
267.text: I know you. I know everything about you. Your thoughts, your feelings, your weaknesses.
267.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor disembarks dragonNodeContext: Emperor is against the player now, and enthralled to the Netherbrain

77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisys advance to flank the Emperor.NodeContext: with pure malice

19.speaker: The Emperor
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisys advance to flank the Emperor.NodeContext: with pure malice

252.speaker: Minsc
252.text: There - let us try the stones on the tyrant's tiara!
252.context: NodeContext: Looking up at the Crown of Karsus on top of the Netherbrain

64.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
64.text: That is our target. Focus the power of the Netherstones on the crown, and we may yet triumph!
64.context: NodeContext: the final battle against the netherbrain is underway - the struggle is desperate, but Minthara rallies herself and her allies with a final command

118.speaker: Narrator
118.text: *The place where the Netherstones can enforce control.*

105.speaker: The Emperor
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks up and sees the Crown of Kharsus.

183.speaker: The Emperor
183.text: The very thing that has been amplifying the Netherbrain's power, and the very place that we will be able to dominate it.
183.context: CinematicNodeContext: Suddenly, four (or equivalent number to party) fleshy growth-pods emerge from the Netherbrain and the super-thralls are birthed from within them.

123.speaker: The Emperor
123.text: That's where we should use the Netherstones.
123.context: CinematicNodeContext: Suddenly, four (or equivalent number to party) fleshy growth-pods emerge from the Netherbrain and the super-thralls are birthed from within them.

3.speaker: Elder Brain

111.speaker: Elder Brain
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Four fleshy growth-pods  emerge from the Netherbrain and the super-thralls are birthed from within them. A red dragon lands. The thralls and dragon prepare for combat.

202.speaker: Elder Brain
202.text: And you will make an even better thrall.

160.speaker: Elder Brain
160.context: CinematicNodeContext: Four fleshy growth-pods  emerge from the Netherbrain and the super-thralls are birthed from within them. A red dragon lands. The thralls and dragon prepare for combat.

40.speaker: Elder Brain
40.text: And you will make spectacular thralls.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Four fleshy growth-pods  emerge from the Netherbrain and the super-thralls are birthed from within them. A red dragon lands. The thralls and dragon prepare for combat.

242.context: CinematicNodeContext: Four fleshy growth-pods  emerge from the Netherbrain and the super-thralls are birthed from within them. A red dragon lands. The thralls and dragon prepare for combat.

269.speaker: Elder Brain
269.text: The hatchling who rejected her queen.

92.speaker: Elder Brain
92.text: The false daughter of darkness. Shunned by her goddess.

101.speaker: Elder Brain
101.text: The puppet of the githyanki queen.

65.speaker: Elder Brain
65.text: The hatchling who rejected her queen.

129.speaker: Elder Brain
129.text: The wizard who defied a goddess.

95.speaker: Elder Brain
95.text: The hamster that voyaged through wildspace.

169.speaker: Astarion
169.context: NodeContext: Dry sarcasm - we're atop the Netherbrain floating above the city, and it has just graphically spawned a number of super-thralls for us to fight

78.speaker: Wyll
78.context: NodeContext: Dry sarcasm - we're atop the Netherbrain floating above the city, and it has just graphically spawned a number of super-thralls for us to fight

69.speaker: Gale
69.text: What in the Hells are those?
69.context: NodeContext: Dry sarcasm - we're atop the Netherbrain floating above the city, and it has just graphically spawned a number of super-thralls for us to fight

199.speaker: Karlach
199.context: NodeContext: Dry sarcasm - we're atop the Netherbrain floating above the city, and it has just graphically spawned a number of super-thralls for us to fight

94.speaker: Halsin
94.text: Fresh horrors. They will fall, like all the others.
94.context: NodeContext: Dry sarcasm - we're atop the Netherbrain floating above the city, and it has just graphically spawned a number of super-thralls for us to fight

225.speaker: Jaheira
225.text: Oh, because it wasn't quite crowded enough up here already.
225.context: NodeContext: Dry sarcasm - we're atop the Netherbrain floating above the city, and it has just graphically spawned a number of super-thralls for us to fight

192.speaker: Minsc
192.text: Eh, Boo? Can this Netherbrain sprout Nether-lice?
192.context: NodeContext: Note of vague bemusement - we've just watched the netherbrain graphically spawn a number of super-thralls that we must fight atop it.

66.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
66.text: Is there no end to these horrors?
66.context: NodeContext: witnessing the creation of horrifying fleshy monsters during the final fight with the netherbrain - aghast, and slightly in awe

96.speaker: Narrator
96.text: *A thought occurs to you as you gaze at the monstrosity above. Gale's orb remains an option - one that could put an end to the Absolute, once and for all.*
96.context: NodeContext: An edge of concern - worried what you're about to bring up

152.speaker: Gale
152.text: You're plotting something, aren't you? Come on then - out with it. I'd rather know before we take on that cerebral monstrosity.
152.context: NodeContext: An edge of concern - worried what you're about to bring up

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Just reminding myself of our plan - we attack the brain, then comes the Emperor's part.

70.speaker: Gale
70.text: As viable a plan as any while staring into the maw of perdition. Shall we?

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Your orb - the fight we're facing could be over before it even begins... if you're willing to make the sacrifice.

81.speaker: Gale
81.text: I thought I made my feelings plain - I do not want to take that step. Not anymore.

224.speaker: Gale
224.text: Besides - such a sacrifice won't be necessary if I claim the Crown of Karsus.

219.speaker: Gale
219.text: You make it sound like such a small thing. No - I do not wish to die.

80.speaker: Gale
80.text: If there is even the slimmest chance of success once we ascend, I wish to pursue it.

210.speaker: Player
210.text: Mystra will never forgive you for refusing her command. Can you live with that?

11.speaker: Gale
11.text: If I live at all, it will be no thanks to her. She didn't even deign to speak to me herself. Let her burn with fury - I choose to live.

270.speaker: Player
270.text: Are you certain you know what you're going to do with it?

106.speaker: Gale
106.text: There's no sense dwelling on such a future is locked behind the looming shadow of the Netherbrain. First, we must fight. Then we deal with the Crown.

239.speaker: Player
239.text: Mystra will never forgive you if you allow the crown to slip from your grasp. The orb guarantees redemption.
239.context: NodeContext: With a sigh - he knows he won't do this.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: The world is counting on us, and the Netherbrain is too powerful. I can't bear the thought of losing you, but the orb is the only guarantee.
162.context: NodeContext: With a sigh - he knows he won't do this.

44.text: No. I can't give up... and I don't want this to be how I part from you. Let us at least try.

148.speaker: Gale
148.text: No. I can't give up... and I don't want this to be how I part from you. Let us at least try.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: The world is counting on us, and the Netherbrain is too powerful. The orb is the only guarantee of victory we have.
108.context: NodeContext: With a sigh - he knows he won't do this.

174.speaker: Gale
174.text: I could simply tell you what you want to hear, then ascend by myself and take on the brain alone, you know.
174.context: NodeContext: With a sigh - he knows he won't do this.

258.speaker: Gale
258.text: I could simply tell you what you want to hear, then ascend by myself and take on the brain alone, you know.
258.context: NodeContext: With a sigh - he knows he won't do this.

214.text: I'm too long in the tooth to play sacrificial lamb - sacrificial bearded goat, more like. I will not just give in to the orb. Not when I've made it this far.

10.speaker: Gale
10.text: I'm too long in the tooth to play sacrificial lamb - sacrificial bearded goat, more like. I will not just give in to the orb. Not when I've made it this far.

263.speaker: Player
263.text: Keep it in mind at least, should the tide of battle turn against us.

46.speaker: Gale
46.text: Should circumstances become that dire, I will not hesitate. But I dearly hope that will not be necessary.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: You're certain, then. I won't try to force you to do otherwise. Let's keep going.

181.speaker: Gale
181.text: I'm glad. It would be more than a touch awkward if you tried and I had to turn on you.

271.speaker: Gale
271.text: That said, should the worst transpire, and we seem destined to fail... well, the orb remains an option. But I truly hope it does not come to that.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I understand, but I had to mention it while there was time. Let's carry on and end this.

203.speaker: Gale
203.text: I'm as ready as I'll ever be. Should the worst transpire, and we seem destined to fail... well, the orb remains an option. But I truly hope it does not come to that.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Just reminding myself of our plan - we attack the brain, then comes Orpheus' part.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Say nothing. You have already transformed yourself in order to stop the Absolute. That should remain the plan.

251.speaker: Player
251.text: It's nothing - just gathering myself. Let's proceed.

138.speaker: Gale
138.text: The brain... it's high above the city now - far away from any innocents.

273.speaker: Narrator
273.text: *As you gaze upwards at the monstrosity above you, the orb in your chest seems to pulse, like a dark second heart.*
